content.description:
This route is located left of Cruel Shoes on the east face of Stripe Rock.

Pitch 1- Climb the slab protected by 4 bolts and some gear to a ledge with a small tree and a two bolt anchor.  5.10c

Pitch 2- Face climb steeper rock past 7? bolts to a two bolt belay near a hole.  5.10a

Pitch 3- Climb the slab past more bolts to a two bolt belay.  5.8

Pitch 4- Easier, more runout climbing leads to a two bolt belay near the summit.
content.protection: Quickdraws and a few pieces of protection for the first pitch.
content.location: Located about 100 feet left of the start of Cruel Shoes on Stripe rock.

content.description: Climb the obvious dike on Stripe rock. Scramble up a small Dyke to gain access to an old homemade bolt and then continue onto the roof. This route is very very runout
content.protection: You can place a .3 on the first pitch in a flake and use a #3 at the roof/horn belay after that you can use a .5 on the Dyke at the second belay if need be but it is detached so becareful.

content.description: A fun and easier multi pitch route that does top out.  3 pitches, with the option to do one or all, though rapping from any of the belay stations will take two ropes. The rating on the first pitch is 5.6, though it feels harder.  It is all bolts, take 16-20 quickdraws.  The descent is to the left then down a westward tending ramp to a single double rope rappell.
content.protection: All Bolts, with two bolt belays.
